## Load libraries

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(DataExplorer)
```


## Vaidate data

We can check that the number of rows and the data itself has no obvious errors

```{bash}

wc -l ../data/raw/*.csv

```


```{bash}

head -n 2 ../data/raw/*.csv

```

Now let's summarise some totals over the numeric features

```{r}
train <- readr::read_csv("../data/raw/train.csv")
test <- readr::read_csv("../data/raw/test.csv")
```

### Dtypes

```{r}
train %>% glimpse
```


### Totals

```{r}
train %>% select_if(is.numeric) %>% map(sum,na.rm=T)
```

### NA's

```{r}
train %>% 
  map(~.x %>% is.na %>% sum)
```

### Initial visualization of data

```{r}
train %>% 
  plot_histogram

ggsave("../reports/figures/histograms.png",width = 14,height = 14)
```

```{r}
train %>% 
  plot_correlation

ggsave("../reports/figures/corrplot.png",width = 14,height = 14)
```
